revised_title: Molecular Surface-Energy of Mixtures of Non-Associating Liquids
tldr: The authors investigate the molecular surface-energy of mixtures of non-associating liquids, such as toluene and piperidine, and find that the coefficient of decrease of molecular surface-energy is the true mean of the two liquids. They also determine the molecular surface-energies of pure substances and discuss the results in relation to surface tension and capillary rise.
